Grayson: s statement about Patrick Murphy taking more money from Wall Street than any other member of Congress was made during an interview with the Tampa Bay Times editorial board on June 30, 2016.
The statement was based on Grayson: s claim that Murphy received more money than anyone else in Congress, specifically referring to direct contributions made to Murphy's campaign committee.
The Center for Responsive Politics: a nonpartisan research group, conducted a study analyzing campaign donations and found that Murphy received $1.41 million from the "finance, insurance and real estate" sector in the 2016 election cycle, ranking him third among all members of the House.
However: when considering the entire Congress, including senators, Murphy's contributions from Wall Street-types ranked No. 19 overall, as senators typically receive more Wall Street money due to their smaller number and more expensive races.
